DataElement.preferredName: Bioassay Intralaboratory Reproducibility Coefficient of Variance Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The intra-lab reproducibility ratio of standard deviation to mean, expressed as a percentage.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)_Occuring within a single lab._The statistical reproducibility of measurements (often in a clinical context), including the testing of instrumentation or techniques to obtain reproducible results. The concept includes reproducibility of physiological measurements, which may be used to develop rules to assess probability or prognosis, or response to a stimulus; reproducibility of occurrence of a condition; and reproducibility of experimental results.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test/analysis of biological activity of a substance by studying its effect on an organism or in test tube under controlled conditions.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occuring within a single lab.:The statistical reproducibility of measurements (often in a clinical context), including the testing of instrumentation or techniques to obtain reproducible results. The concept includes reproducibility of physiological measurements, which may be used to develop rules to assess probability or prognosis, or response to a stimulus; reproducibility of occurrence of a condition; and reproducibility of experimental results.

Concepts.definition: The ability to yield similar results given a set of constraints.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Assay Reproducibility Coefficient of Variance Number
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The ratio of standard deviation to mean, expressed as a percentage.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Assay Reproducibility Coefficient of Variance Number
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.:The statistical reproducibility of measurements (often in a clinical context), including the testing of instrumentation or techniques to obtain reproducible results. The concept includes reproducibility of physiological measurements, which may be used to develop rules to assess probability or prognosis, or response to a stimulus; reproducibility of occurrence of a condition; and reproducibility of experimental results.:The ratio of standard deviation to mean, expressed as a percentage.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological properties of a drug.
The ability to yield similar results given a set of constraints.
The ratio of standard deviation to mean, expressed as a percentage or fraction.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
